author: Gh Ost
title: Used the website please don’t
text: Used the website, for quotes. I Was immediately swarmed with pushy sales calls 10+ per day quoting rates significantly higher than what’s posted on the site! I tried to contact a property owner to discuss their actual rate, to find out he didn’t own the property!! The calls have not stopped! The rates keep going up lol. My spam folder is up to 216 with this company, it’s been 2 weeks. No unsubscribe button! Beware and check the BBB and other sites as this one seems a little fake.

author: Chris A
title: Car gone and protection plan not honored
text: I rented a space to store my vehicle using Neighbor. I purchased the protection plan. During this time my vehicle was towed because the person I leased from was evicted and my vehicle was sold. They do not honor their protection plan and refuse to speak with you on the phone. Do not use this service

author: Jasmine Timon
title: This owner isn’t a resident at this location and they aren’t authorized to rent this space .
text: I want to share my experience renting a parking spot from Troy, as it raises serious concerns. Initially, I believed this space would be secure; however, it has become clear that he does not actually reside in the unit. He would often instruct me to enter the gates behind other vehicles due to his frequent absences, which made me question the legitimacy of this arrangement. Adding to my concerns, I received two parking tickets while using this space, indicating that he does not have the authority to rent it out. This individual is knowingly leasing a space without the right to do so, misrepresenting their residency while collecting payments for a service they are not authorized to provide. This is clearly fraudulent behavior. Therefore, I strongly urge Neighbor to review this situation carefully and consider removing this host from their platform to protect potential renters from experiencing similar issues in the future.

author: Name Unknown
title: No reply from the one I contacted
text: No reply from the one I contacted, instead i get many messages from neighbor marketing offering more expensive units. terrible company.  I just use public storage.

author: K Z (KZ)
title: 25% lost in fees.
text: I have no problem with the $50 a month fee. However they charge a whole bunch of other fees, including 5% just to get paid. Payment is 1 month later. When all is done the fees abount to about 25%. Their model sucks and is designed to fleece the renter.

author: Slava Viktorenkov
title: Bunch of liars and scammers!
text: Bunch of liars and scammers! They will get you with the subscription, that you never intended to have.

author: David
title: My host was an out of control idiot who…
text: My host was an out of control idiot who didn’t read his own contract.  Per my contract there were no reserved spots but my host claimed I was parked where I wasn’t supposed to be.  When I pointed out to him that he was incorrect he decided I needed to move boat ASAP.  Within 12 hours or he would have it towed so I was forced to take off work.  The people at Neighbor were of NO HELP and only interested in collecting their fee.  Certainly not interested in dealing with a rogue host!

author: Lu SIfer
title: What a pathetic app where you can't use…
text: What a pathetic app where you can't use a name you prefer so they kick you out of the app indefinitely! But they know my address so what is so incriminating about giving a name that I go by but you know exactly where I live because I put my location on! What a pathetic app! A guy trying to better himself by looking for jobs on the app! What a way to take food out of my mouth! If I could you would get -1 stars PATHETIC!!!

author: Scott
title: Be ware of scammers
text: They host a company posing as a legitimate garage parking host. I was able to cancel before the 24 hours once I realized this wasn't legit. But now neighbor won't stop calling me to "fix" the issue. Here is one way...post the review I submitted about the company so others don't get caught up in the scam...and I don't know....maybe kick them off your page.

author: Michael LaVecchia
title: Someone called back to back to back 3…
text: Someone called back to back to back 3 times right in a row while I was at an appointment…for this reason alone I wish to be removed from any and all lists and placed on your do not contact list.  Super unprofessional and just downright rude.

author: Michelle McKeever
title: Transitional and unsafe!
text: Watch out! Neighbor.com can SCAM. Auto renew does not cancel. Online form mishandles coordinating information to vendors! This online, fly-by-night company cannot yet address serious situations. Transitional and unsafe!  My Lexus was TOWED due to a "bug" where online form supports the input of VIN number.  Company unresponsive and continued on with months of auto renewal payments.  AVOID Neighbor.com!

author: Jeremy DeeEm
title: The Neighbor-hood Sucks
text: Where to begin.  I could right volumes about the dysfunction and ineptitude of Neighbor.com. My most recent issue hosting with Neighbor.com:  they failed to vet a scammer named Felix Odhiambo that reserved a spot on my land for a month.  On the very first day, Felix used his truck to destroy most of my driveway and also leave 2' deep ruts in the grassy areas.  Then he left without reporting the severe damage. Did Neighbor help address the issue.  Hell no.  Rather than answer my messages promptly, they refunded the scammer, docked my payout by 70% (without notification to me) and waited a full week to finally respond, telling me they won't help one bit. I have so many horror stories with Neighbor.com.  If you're dumb enough to list with them, prepare for the onslaught of calls from their staff trying to force fit potential renters onto your space despite your very clear listing about what can and cannot be stored. Oh, and leave a constructive review and the owners will respond with a passive aggressive and snarky response rather than acknowledging their errors. Just remember that all of their policies-- from very delayed payouts to only unilaterally allowing guests to leave reviews of hosts, but not the other way around. Steer clear of these yahoos. I'm another host that will have to seek legal remedies to get them to do the right thing. The really crazy part is that I've instructed them to close my account several times and they won't!

author: blue sky
title: I would’ve given zero if possible
text: I would’ve given zero if possible. The worst Customer Service ever. I have a storage space and I wanted to list it with them they used to call me Or text me or email me multiple times a day, the listing was put as draft and not published. And when I had questions, they will not answer the questions And they completely ignored and never responded To my questions, But the reply used to talk about how to publish And they keep on insisting to rent my storage for way cheaper. I asked the same question four times and four times they ignore the question and keep talking about something else. I can definitely tell you that whatever makes them money. That’s The only thing they talk about. They don’t address your concerns. They don’t address any issues. I am out of words if they will not even answer your questions what is the point in event paying them for your own space and making them money? Obviously, needless to say, I posted on other sites and I already found people renting within 48 hours. I had to even research to see if this is a legitimate site or not as this almost sounds like a site with bots. Only one sided talking.

author: RD
title: They stole my van
text: Avoid this company at all costs. I paid for a parking spot through Neighbor, but my van got wrongfully towed for no reason with no notice. I only realized 6 weeks into my subscription when I went to move my van and it was gone. I found out it had been towed and the towing company demanded $5,000 to return it! Neighbor admitted it was their fault and said they could get the money from the parking garage, but instead of just paying the towing company, they told me I had to pay $5,000 upfront in cash. I told them I don’t have $5,000 and that they could have easily paid the tow yard directly or sent me the money first. They refused. While they kept delaying, the tow company put a lien on my van and sold it. Thanks to Neighbor, I lost my van, and now they won’t take responsibility. Absolute scam.

author: Russle
title: 100% Risk: This App Put My Truck in Danger"**
text: This app does not provide clear information, pictures, or exact addresses. The worst part about this app is that it is not safe for your truck, car, or belongings. I would not recommend this app to anyone. There is a 100% chance that your vehicle or item could end up in the hands of criminals. Do not use the Neighbors app if you want to keep your vehicle safe. Instead, consider booking with a more reliable app. Neighbors is not a trustworthy or reliable app. My truck was booked through this app and parked in an unauthorized space, which resulted in a ticket and my vehicle being tow warned

author: Ocean
title: Horrific company
text: Horrific company. I have been a host for about 18 months and their customer service is beyond horrific. Despite multiple requests to speak to a live person over many months, I have never received any response. There is zero support for hosts and that's essential because some renters will lie just to secure your space. I have also had several of their rental employees give false info to potential renters in order to secure a new client.

author: Amanda
title: Terrible billing system
text: Terrible billing system. I ended my Paid account. I then continued to receive delinquent account notifications, for 4 weeks after my account was over. Terrible, terrible billing services and customer service. * I will never use Neighbor again. The most unorganized app I’ve ever used.

title: We went through them because we had to
text: We went through them because we had to. Thet are basically a billing company. Non of the communication regarding our Rec Nation storage unit came from them. We canceled our storage unit through Rec Nation. We gave early notice, and were out over 10 days before we were supposed to be. But guess who kept taking payments? Neighbor did. Even after receiving an email from them directly, that charges will be reversed. And funds taken would be returned. Its just another greedy little corporate pig feeding at rhe trough of hard working, and un suspecting folks. I will avoid any company using them in the future.And still fighting 6 weeks later for money they didn't earn.

author: Gregory Lampe, MD
title: Car Was Stolen While Being Stored with Neighbor.com
text: I was initially excited about Neighbor.com—it seemed like a great concept. However, my experience turned into a nightmare. I rented a parking space for my 2015 Honda Accord, and for the first three months, everything seemed fine. Then, my car was STOLEN from the rented space. What’s worse, I received no assistance from the host or from Neighbor.com in trying to recover it. There was no meaningful support, no help in navigating the situation, and no real accountability from the platform. My car is still missing, and this experience has left me deeply disappointed. If you’re considering using Neighbor.com for vehicle storage, think twice—there is little to no security, and you’re on your own if something goes wrong.

author: Luis alejandro Rivera
title: Worst scam ever
text: Worst scam ever. Im a host , the renter did no pay for 3 months and i couldnt do anything .. i reach out to the platform but they said 4 months into i will be allow to tow the camper . Do no do bussiness with those ppl . There are the worst scam

author: Mommamia05
title: lots of calls to get banking info but…
text: lots of calls to get banking info but --the company has NO main office phone # to call. just contracted sales reps working from home whenever.... no 24/7 english speaking real humans. seems more of a chinese scam or govt data collection site. not seeing real happy campers or renters or hosts.

author: Alex J. S.
title: I’m disappointed with Neighbor.com…
text: I’m disappointed with Neighbor.com customer service - when I contacted them that I have a bad experience with their host - Neighbor rep was not helpful. I was forced to remove my travel trailer early because their host was unprofessional jerk - he became hostile as soon as I was charged for the full month, my trailer was removed days later but no partial credit or refund was given as I understood (from Neighbor management) will be the case.

Unfortunately this company follows suit of so many other where you have a problem and they basically say fix it yourself.   This is far from the service I received a year ago when I gave a shining review.

author: David Kinderdine
title: I am a first time host
text: I am a first time host. I discovered they did not honor the price I set. They charged the renter a high fee and shorted me what I was due. I also could not register my bank account # to be paid. Their customer service is of little use. They will not call you and randomly answer their email. It bad enough they wait 30 days to pay you and then not making it easy to be paid is very frustrating.

author: Anne
title: This is not a serious company. Do not use them
text: I was unable to move in to the parking space as scheduled despite assurances from the Neighbors agent that I would have 24/7 move-in access when I booked. The building had no record of the reservation and could give no indication of when I would get access to the garage, other than that it would be at least 24-48 hours. This left me scrambling to make other arrangements. Meanwhile Neighbors has not responded to three messages requesting a refund, and their support line is always unstaffed. This is a not a serious company. Do not use them.

title: You need to do better if you want people to continue using their space so your company can make money

author: Kevin Mahar
title: Make sure your town won’t decide that you can’t store vehicles
text: The town decided that even though it was not against any regulation that I could no longer store vehicles on my property. The whole process was extremely stressful. So many people were irate that they had to move, and that the email that was sent out by NEIGHBOR said that they would be assisted in finding other places to rent. However, they were not assisted. I also asked for assistance from NEIGHBOR, which once I eventually connected with someone, they were actually very thorough and helpful.

author: Marina LaRue
title: I stopped the reservation the same day…
text: I stopped the reservation the same day I made it and notified the host. A month later was charged for sept  and oct. I emailed Neighbor and explained I the situation and they only gave me an 80 percent refund because "The host held the spot for me and deserves compensation" The only reason I stopped the reservation the same day was because the host Mark had to go mow his yard and couldn't take my RV for at least another 5 days. So I found another spot to store it. I did everything right and still got charged for a spot I never used. Very sketchy company!

author: Jeremy DeeEm
title: Don't criticize them or they will violate privacy and reveal sensitive customer data publicly.  They also refuse to follow their own terms of service.
text: UPDATE: Neighbor.com's response to my critical review is to reveal sensitive customer data and, well... just lie their asses off in a snarky and deameaning manner.  As such, I've updated my star rating from 2-star to 1-star. Read their response... its completely an invasion of privacy and gaslighting the situation in an attempt to make themselves look better rather than apologize for their blatant misdeeds.  DO NOT TRUST THIS COMPANY. Also note that whenever someone posts a critical review of Neighbor.com, magically 3-4 fake glowing reviews are posted in the hours after. Congrats on failing How to Respond to a Critical Review 101.  Gaslighting?  Revealing customer information and data?  Snarky response?  Attempt to spin the narrative?  No acknowledgement of responsibility? No apology? Passive aggressive much? In my case, Neighbor.com knowingly allowed a customer that never once visited the property or bring their vehicle post a retaliatory 1-star review as retribution for not getting a full refund.  Neighbor.com claims to only accept relevant and unbiased reviews, but actually discourages both. If Neighbor.com actually cared about the integrity of the review process, there would be a bilateral review policy that posts both reviews of landowners and customers.  Don't believe the rhetoric and propaganda they spew; they're a high pressure sales driven organization and overcharges customers, underpays landowners and they refuse to close a landowner's account despite numerous written requests. Neighbor.com simply refuses to follow their own terms of service regarding review content.  They also claim to have a fair review process, but it is entirely unilateral, with only the customer providing a review the landowner and not the other way around let me tell you…like bad landowners, there are some really bad customers out there.  Why protect one and not the other? Neighbor.com also charges excessive service fees and hold onto funds for prolonged amounts of time before disbursement to landowner in order to make money off the interest you pay PLUS their exorbitant fees and excessive hidden costs.

author: Kate

text: So many lovely things on the website, but always sold out. More stock needs to be bought in. Really frustrating.

author: Consumer
title: If I could give zero stats I would
text: If I could give zero stats I would. We had a customer stop paying 6 months ago, neighbor paid for the first sixty days but has failed to secure towing services. There customer service is non existent, no response to emails and the phone lines are no longer operational. Don’t become a host unless you’re okay with having a big uninsured liability left on you property that you’re not being paid for.

author: Darrell K
title: Neighbor's Customer Service EARNS A 1Star Ratingr
text: Yesterday, my father-in-law sent me a link that showed me some space rentals. I'm a disabled vet now retired so I'm on a VERY fixed income. I've been renting a 10X20 unit for 11 years and that rent has gone through the roof. I found a space, well priced so it will save me money and be closer to where I'm at. I contacted the host via the Neighbor app. We exchanged messages. He said he'd call me today and indeed a call came in with the ID said, Neighbor. I answered. It wasn't the host it was customer service rep. I could barely understand her broken English but, the bottom line was she wanted me to Reserve the place and give them my method of payment right then. I fonx̌t know about you, but I don't lay out money, upfront sight unseen and told her exactly that. In fact I had to tell her that 4 (FOUR) times. To say that she was aggressive is a bit understated. I wasn't rude, but I was adamant and when I told her the 4th time, she hung up on me. There's quite a lot of 1Star reviews about Neighbor.com and now there's one more.

author: C J
title: HORRIBLE PRIVACY INVASION
text: I joined looking to rent a driveway. Phone number is listed as private in your profile, and I assumed would only be shared once I contacted a host, agreed to something, AND settled payment. Nope. A day after registering I am getting calls from unknown local numbers and some "specialist" from the site leaving me voicemails about storage spaces. Blocked them all. I did NOT consent for my personal phone # to be shared so blatantly. Immediately clicked the button to delete my account but it says it will take a day AND that they will try to call me again. Horrible and creepy!

The ball was stuck onto the hitch ao I had to go home to get the ball off and purchase an appropriate ball. I did so and was heading back, all within the time I had paid for, but the renter cancelled the rental and the n=company refused to return my money. I didn't cancel the rental but they kept my money.

author: Over This
title: Guarantee is MEANINGLESS, and staff is a bunch of TROLLS :(
text: First, I got a derilict renter who parked what was likely a stolen vehicle in my space, and "Neighbor," with their MEANINGLESS guarantee, would do absolutely Nothing to get the car towed ...and because I mentioned that I have an "HOA" (Condo Board) through whom I'd have to get the car towed, since Neighbor was no help, and expressed that I was frustrated, they then "SUSPENDED" _MYYY_ membership,when I was the victim(!), and started requiring me to prove that I'm allowed to rent my space, with a letter from my HOA ...YET, even though my account was "suspended," my listing still stayed active, and I was still getting renters, BUT _not able to communicate_ with them, which was stressful, and when I asked them that I'm still able to get reservations and please (unrestrict my account, and) let me communicate with members, the representative NASTILY quipped "Thanks for pointing that out," and DROPPED THE BOMB ON ME that they had shut down my account, and my renter was gone-- ..._I am out of work, right now, and this rental was my only small source of income_, and I AM DEVASTATED... Please, don't use Neighbor, because, it's unimaginable how much can go wrong, seriously wrong, and not only will they not have your back, if you complain they will PUNISH you :( Good luck everyone out there, I hope you can find alternate sources of income... And ...Be kind to each other, please :(

author: Zachary Snavely
title: Vehicle Towed from Paid Neighbor Parking Space
text: Summary: Car was towed while using Neighbor. They won't reimburse. Story: Unfortunately, I would give Zero stars if that was possible. I had used Neighbor several times for long term vehicle storage, as it was less expensive than parking at the airport. I would pay Neighbor, park my car, and take an Uber for my flight, returning weeks later. After my most recent work trip I returned via Lyft to find my car gone. I tried contacting the "host" with no answer. I called Neighbor Customer Service, and the woman was very kind but unable to do another except try to reach out to the host. I then called the police who confirmed my car had been towed. I was able to pay my driver extra to sit with me for a few hours (in the night, in the rain, in a bad part of town), while I waited to have my car released from impound. The cost for release was $425, and I paid my Lyft driver an additional $50 for waiting with me for three hours. While Neighbor initially asked for receipts from the towing company, they now maintain that the storage of my vehicle is not their responsibility (even though I had paid them for this service). I have been going back and forth with them for three weeks since the incident. I have apparently spoken to the highest available person on the phone, who is the receptionist (very nice at least). She maintains that her manager, the person in charge, isn't able to speak to customers on the phone. They have assured me they have forwarded my feedback to the management team, but won't be offering a refund for my towing fees. At the bottom of the Neighbor website, there is text stating, "Safety and Support: As long as you're with Neighbor, you're protected." What a joke.

author: Arifuz Zaman
title: Horrible customer service!!

IM NOW QUITTING NEIGHBOR (BUT ILL BE STAYING IN THE SAME PLACE IF YOU GET MY MEANING)

author: Jupiter Jones
title: Got cheated by a rental owner, Neighbor.com does nothing
text: rented a space from a person on Neighbor.com, according to very specific rental dates. Rental owner cheated me, robbed, and will not refund the money. I contacted Neighbor.com, and they will do nothing. Thanks a lot, Neighbor.com.  Good job taking my money and standing up for your renters (sarcasm)

author: Larry Courtney
title: Do not use!
text: Do not use!! Beware!! I rented space for about 5 months. No longer needed the space. I told the host this. I was then charged twice. I contacted the host and they said they have no control over the money. In their policy it states that the host can cancel the reservation. I called Neighbor and they said they have a strict refund policy and that it was MY responsibility to cancel. Then they said the best they could do is a 70% refund. My monthly was $65 but they refunded $35. Obviously this is not 70%. They said they do not refund the fees. Neighbor is a terrible app and company.

author: hansel llina
title: Customer service will harass owners
text: You will be sent a barrage of texts and emails and calls if you don’t respond to reservations immediately. This is even true if you already have a guest in the parking stall through neighbor. They will also take away payouts after reservation based on renters comments and reviews. Do not recommend.

author: James Beecroft
title: Host Needs Mental Evaluation
text: a friend of mine and I were splitting the cost of keeping a car hauler at a woman's house in mapleton, utah.. Alyssa P or G. upon arrival today I had pulled up probably 2 minutes before she did to put a hoist lift on the trailer so we can use it. when the host Alyssa showed up got out of her car and started screaming at me for what I don't know but apparently she was having a bad day or something else was going on maybe mental issues long story short I started to try and reason with her it figured I was losing the battle she told me I was trespassing even though our trailer is on her property totally forgot who I was I even had to remove my glasses and hat to say you remember me I've talked to you three times since I've been here and we started renting in January so she seen me she knows who I am but she said she doesn't recall and that I need to send her a message through neighbor that I'm going to show up. to top things off she pulled out her phone and started recording me in the street as I was leaving saying I was harassing her and I basically just gave up and said you know you're the one walked all the way across your grass to put a phone up and say I was driving who's you know who's driving away I am so I highly highly highly recommend the neighbor possibly might ask for mental health records because this lady seriously cuckoo now she actually called the police they came out over nothing over her not taking her meds or whatever I don't know I don't know what her problem was but she trying to have me locked up for coming to work on our trailer. I implore neighbor to reevaluate this host Alyssa in mapleton Utah and warn anybody else that's in the area that she is dangerous and her kids play on all your stuff and drawing it with crayons and destroy things and she'll try and get you to pay on the side and at least she did us anyway I don't know about anybody else but stay away from her I hope neighbor looks into this and gets rid of her because she is some trash.

author: D C
title: Don't do it! Don't even think about it!! Thieves
text: Don't do it. They're manipulative thieves. They baited and switched my rental unit. It was supposed to be double the size. I notices this as my rental truck was dropping off my storage items. I had to buy and additional storage unit on the fly and then do an extra delivery there. They are blaming the owner of the rental unit and he's blaming them for the miscalculation. Who knows? They gave me 1 month free equal to $137.90 which was nothing compared to the extra drop by the truck and the extra 4 months that I had to pay for the space that I didn't get with my Neighbor rental. Now get this too. My contract billing was paid for the last month on July 12th. I was out of there on July 15th. I learned today on July 17th that they credited me $56.45 when it should've been $124.55. They said that was their policy and they didn't have to refund at all. I can't wait for them to get what they deserve when their malicious practices catch up with them.

author: James
title: The worst service I have ever used
text: Words cannot describe how terrible this service is. I rented space through Neighbor and the person renting the space moved into the storage unit. Neighbor assured me that they would help remove him from the space and cover all fees. After 60 days, they gave up and told me I had to take on legal costs to remove the renter and best of all, they cancelled the reservation 1 day before the payout and said they would not payout the scheduled rent any longer. Stay away from this company.

author: Jon Keene
title: Zero for two w/ Neighbor Storage
text: I tried twice to store my RV while recently traveling around the country.  The first spot I reserved the "host" ghosted me the day prior to my arrival so I ended up having to make an alternate short term storage solution.  Neighbor agreed with me and provided 100% refund which was appreciated and expected. The 2nd reservation a few weeks later was for 3 months on the other side of the country and when I arrived to store my RV the storage space was full.  The "host" tried to get someone to move items around but proceeded to get stuck. So again I had to scramble to find another storage location.  In this case Neighbor provided me with only a 70% refund stating that 1- I did not cancel before I arrived (how would I know there was an issue before I got there??? and  2 - the host did not agree that I should receive a full refund ( like somehow this was partly my fault???)  After these experiences I would definitely not recommend Neighbor Storage for your storage needs.  Go to a reputable storage company that you can rely on even if you have to pay a little more. Note the response from Neighbor - if there is an issue with your storage and the host does not agree to a refund then you don't get one.  Kind of like the fox watching the hen house - remember that when making your reservations that you are at the mercy of the host.......

author: Elizabeth
title: DANA KIEL scam
text: This woman (DANA KIEL) rented me her driveway and then harassed me asking for MORE money. "If I do not receive payment in 20 minutes the police officer that’s here will have the bus towed immediately." "Venmo me the $500 @Dana-Kiel-3"

author: Al in Denver
title: Thieves
text: I used Neighbor.com to find inside storage for a vehicle over the winter.  I moved out of the unit in March and Neighbor continued to charge my debit card the $135/month for three months before I noticed today.  I reached out to neighbor.com and they would only refund $252 of the $405 that they stole from me.  Absolute larceny.  This company and the people that rent through them are thieves.  Stay away

author: Douglas Okamoto
title: Creepy Overreach
text: I listed on neighbor.com for over a year and had good renters and flaky ones as well; overall experience is no better than using Craigslist for free.  Forget about neighbor.com’s claim that they provide “protections”.  The major problem with neighbor.com is that they try to limit communication between you and the prospective renter by blocking phone numbers and blanking certain text in the messages that you send through their platform.  I get that they want owners to collect payment through the neighbor.com app, but they stifle business by choking communication between owners and potential renters to arrange for viewings and to negotiate rental amounts. Recently, I got creepy passive aggressive messages from neighbor.com asserting that I was going around the app, when I was doing no such thing.  After a few of these incidences, neighbor.com completely lost my trust and I am much happier with my alternatives.  Neighbor.com needs to let go of their insecurities and build trust in users if they want to do well as a company.  If the company has an inviting platform, people will use it.  For now, use Craigslist for free.

author: Nate M
title: Despicable and unethical
text: The app has scammers on it. My vehicle was towed from the parking spot that I reserved through Neighbor. I'm now 6+ weeks without my vehicle. I have a $7,000 tow bill and the loan company is threatening to reposes the vehicle. Neighbor has taken zero responsibility and managing this whole stressful ordeal has turned into a part-time job. I'm playing musical chairs between Neighbor, the host, the tow company, the cops and the loan company. Most importantly, I repeat: Neighbor has taken zero responsibility. I would highly suggest to run from this company and never risk using them. The money you think you're saving can very likely backfire.

author: Lea C
title: HOST notified when/why, moved out cancelled charge for 5 months after
text: Your APP makes it hard to cancel.  Fix your app. We did not create a report for tire damage.  True. Our response and decision was to MOVE OUT. Host was notified when and WHY. Our decision not to pursue compensation for vandalism while at your site is very independent of our canceling your service.  They are not the same.  What customer wants their vehicle damaged while paying for parking? Then, what customer intends to continuing paying for parking they are not using for an extra 5 months AFTER NOTICE of vandalism?  Do what is right. We did not make you responsible for the damage to the tires. Decision was to move to a more secure parking location.  This decision is not equal a wish to continue paying for service we are not using for an extra 5 months.  Two different actions. We did not formally report on your process. We decided to move the car instead.  Host was notified. Did try to cancel your app did not cooperate.  Fix your app. Refund 5 months of non-service.  Do what is right. Do not confuse the two issues. This is not a location where there are hundreds of cars.  Our was a LIMO and your HOST was very well aware WE MOVED!! Only limo on the lot. Cannot be confused. Do what is right. Stop giving excuses.  Do what is right for a customer.

I send a polite email to the host CHRISTIAN, and he ignores me completely. Then 24vhours go by and they cancel me and tell me it could take up to a week to get my money back? HORRIBLE SCAM SITE. title: Neighbor won’t refund money
text: Neighbor asked for my credit card and eventually charged me for a space I never used. Overall the charges ran for four months when I discovered it on my bank statement. I called them on the phone and they only gave me the last month back and refused to refund the other three months even though I never rented the space. It’s basically pretty much of a scam although they do provide product if you are able to navigate through some of the confusion. By not refunding the money, both Neighbor and the guy that had the space profit off of what they say was my mistake. I never got the use of the space on even know where it is.

author: Brett
title: Neighbor takes the side of schizo customers over well-meaning hosts.
text: Well, these guys went from 5 to 1 star real quick. Do NOT host with this app. You will get schizos coming to your apartment, loiter outside my apartment for like 8 hours, overstuffing my room with ridiculous amount of stuff. He suddenly got violent and cursing dropping f-bombs over the app and I told Neighbor immediately, they saw how crazy he was and suggested police. In the end managed to kick him out but app still let's him rate me 1 star, saying "oh freedom of speech". WTH? The absolute least Neighbor could do at this point is delete the 1-star review, and they fail to do that. Stay away unless you enjoy getting spit in the face

author: Andrea
title: Predatory company running a scam
text: They say that you have 7 days before they charge a late fee. I was told they try to charge your card every 48 hours. That is a lie. I have notifications from my bank that they tried EVERY day but the last day before the late fee would be added. That is the only time they waited 48 hours so they could then charge a late fee. The money was in my account on the last day they should have attempted before the late fee. This is the 2nd time they've done this. They are ripping people off and taking advantage of them. They know people will pay the late fee because they don't want to lose their belongings. Find a better option and avoid this predatory company and their scam. In response to their reply, they are blatantly lying. I was not referring to last month. I was referring to DECEMBER 2022. Last momth you took the payment and the late fee payment. I had no problem with November because my payment was late. However, I have proof that you took the whole amount and there was no courtesy refund of a late fee. You might be trying to cover NOW with a courtesy refund because my bank says I'm only being charged with the original amount. This was only AFTER I did what I said I would by letting people know what kind of company you really are. You need to stop lying in your replies and trying to twist facts.

author: Peter E
title: This smells like a scam
text: This smells like a scam, and acts like one.  First of all they want a credit card just to ask the owner where the garage is.  The owner must "approve" a "reservation" in order to communicate and then the credit card is charged.  In my case, the "owner" did not actually control the space and tried to switch me from a garage to a covered space.  In the meantime, Neighbor charged me for the 1st month's rent.  I tried calling the 801 number on the credit card charge but there apparently is no such number.  I emailed support --                 nothing....  The "owner" is still listing garage as available however.  SCAM!!!! A second owner tried to limit the times I could access the garage to a 4 hour slot 5 days a week with advance notice. Total waste of time and, obviously, at best a hassle to get a refund for a product that doesn't exist.

author: r m
title: No deals here
text: Was looking for self storage but the prices were no better than commercial facilities so why bother?

author: customer
title: They take your money upfront...
text: Signed up to find a space to temporarily park a 23' sailboat. Located a space and the site required that payment be made upfront before the deal was even finalized by property owner. Huh? Then, when the deal fell through (property owner had already used the space and forgot to remove the listing), the funds for the deal had already been deducted from the credit card by neighbor.com, and would not be returned for "3 to 5 days". What??? It appears that the neighbor.com service uses this process as interest-free temp funding for themselves, instead of using an escrow or small deposit or micro withdrawal system to pre-verify transaction funds. Whether by design or incompetence, neighbor.com jams up your funds for for "3 to 5 days" on denied transactions, which is bogus. Approve the deal with the property owner via messaging prior and/or offsite first before running it through neighbor.com for payment. Or go around them altogether, lol. Duh.

author: Emma Daguste
title: THESE PEOPLE STOLE MY MONEY
text: THESE PEOPLE STOLE MY MONEY! I rented a place for two months from July 18 to September 18th. I was charged for 3 months...an additional month after I removed my vehicle on the 17th. I tried to remove my credit card the same day but their website would not allow me to remove my credit card number until my vehicle was actually removed. Then they charged me the next day, on the 18th.   When I e-mailed them, they said that there was nothing they could do because they already sent it to the host.  I contacted the host and she would not refund my money even though she showed me 3 different credit transactions that she received from Neighbors on my behalf.  She tried to rationalize it as 3 months, wanting to charge me for the whole month of July which is not fair!  I started on July 18th!  I will not use this service again and would not refer anyone!  Be careful with this service.

author: Mark
title: SCAM, SCAM, SCAM!!!   STAY FAR AWAY!
text: SCAM, SCAM, SCAM  --- this site is full of scam fake hosts collecting from false locations.  I read now from other renters that their vehicle got towed like mine and they got no support from Neighbor so I expect none and you should stay far away or risk losing whatever you are storing and paying to do so!  Got my lein notice today to let me know my vehicle was towed.  Tow company wanted more than vehicle worth.  Now paying to give away my vehicle! I did email the neighbor support address (there is no phone number). Got a response from neighbor.com today asking for more information which I will send.

author: GG
title: Not worth it
text: I have this app for a while but never actually signed up. I want to rent out my garage space or driveway to make some money. I’ve been checking out other listings and trying to see what other hosts do. I finally signed up few days ago. I stopped when they asked me to upload my ID. I want to wait till after I list my space which I’m not ready yet. Within hours I started receiving texts that asked why my sign-up not complete. If I don’t complete soon, they will call me, which they did multiple times. And more texts too. I blocked all the calls and ignore all texts. That’s very intrusive and unnecessary. After reading tons of negative reviews, plus my own experience here, I deleted my account.

author: Jessica Mathers
title: Insanely Pushy Sales People, 2 calls+text in one day
text: I signed up yesterday to look for places to store my vehicle and sent a message to one host asking if he was on a bus line. Fast forward `13 hours and I've received 2 phone calls and one text from salespeople trying to get me to reserve and pay for the spot before I know if it's on the bus line. This is WAY overboard. I requested that they delete my account and not to contact me again.

author: Jazzy B.
title: Beware of their payment policy…
text: Beware of their payment policy as they're not clear. I may have to go to the BBB to check out what my rights are. I was on vacation in Las Vegas and my car broke down the car shop informed me back they could not fix my car & I couldn't keep my car there. well I live in San Diego so I needed to ship the car back home. Until I came up with the money to do that I needed to park my car somewhere safe. I came across neighbor.com, The host I used was very good he went above and beyond he worked with all 3 of my tow truckers. He even held on to my keys and kept my car under video surveillance so I can feel comfortable. I let him know my car was only going to be there for about 2-3 weeks. When I looked for my reservation I placed I was only going to need the space for no longer than a month (site gives you options of: one week, one month, or multiple months). So I need the reservation for 1 month They charged me close to $60. Nothing there said the $60 was a discounted first month price. Once my car was picked up and shipped back home I canceled the rest of my reservation, which was another 2 weeks. Next thing I know I'm getting charges that I'm still disputing today from neighbor. When I finally was able to talk to a human (because they give you a robot at first). They let me know that was just a discounted first month and because I didn't continue on with the second month. So they had to charge me the full amount. When I looked on a reservation it said nothing about that! I wouldn't have booked the reservation if I knew that! I let the person I was on the phone with know how silly that sound when my reservation was literally made for one month! I didn't click on multiple months as an option just simply 1 month. All he could do was apologize and say that's their policy which I saw nothing about that. Definitely feels like a scam. I will never use them again. I was going to tell everybody about the site. considering I work in entertainment and how often my artist and friends are out there in Vegas. Good thing I placed this on my cash app card where I can keep locking my card and disputing the charges until I can get them to stop. I'll keep you guys updated about my current experience, as I have my lawyer looking over to see what I can legally do for the time being. I'm definitely going to go to the BBB and let them know what unfair practices They are practicing. I would have been fine if they had told me up front once you end your reservation you're going to get charged another $60 instead of it being a surprise. Because I wouldn't have booked that, I would have just called the hotel I was staying at and paid them an extra $100 to keep my car there since I only needed the space for 2 weeks.

author: Al S
title: scams and poor service
text: scams and poor service On first impression, the site looks and feels legit and with an interface akin to airbnb or similar, but something seems to be deeply wrong with this startup.  A real shame, it's a great idea. Pushy agents called and messaged me prior to my booking. 1st booking was canceled for no good reason. 2nd booking was a scam: the people at the location had the space blocked and knew nothing about the space being listed. Avoid.

author: Ellie
title: Billing Scam
text: I needed a space for 4 days and was told that a 30-day rental was required.  Host and Neighbor.com were aware of timing as it was discussed at length.  Ultimately, I agreed to pay the full month as no other options were available. The following month my credit card was charged for another 30 days.  The host was surprised and disappointed.  Neighbor.com refunded the second month’s charge but withheld approximately $20 for a “late” cancellation fee.  After emailing Neighbor.com twice, my request for a full refund was rejected.  Scam!!  Do not give these folks your cc number.  I have notified Mastercard of the illegal charge and shared written communications.  My time is worth more than $20, but I’m continuing to fight as I’m tired of all the scams.

author: Scott Shappe
title: Pushy salesmen
text: I got halfway through a listing because I was curious about it. I was texted by a representative to complete it, and I told the representative that the space was not yet ready. He encouraged me to list it anyway (red flag number one), and I said that I would not until it was ready, and that it would not be for several months. He then proceeds to start calling me, which prompts me to let him know that I will never be using this site as long as it employees people that don't understand the difference between checking on prospects and harassing them. Matthew, if you read this, consider a different career where you don't have to meet a quota.

author: Franck Dernoncourt
title: They'll spam your phone number
text: They'll spam your phone number. Woke me up in the morning. Also the service is very unreliable. Don't use them

author: Jaime Macinnis
title: Beware - Do not have their act together.
text: I responded to a listing and signed up only to find it was out of the area I was wanting to be in. Cancelled immediately but nevertheless was billed not once, not twice but three times even after working with customer service. Then I was told because I disputed the charge they banned me from the website. The only reason I went to the website was to confirm the reservation was cancelled. These guys have a lot of growing to do. Would never consider using them again.

author: Denis
title: Using neighbor.com costed me over $10,000 in damages. Beware!
text: Using neighbor.com costed me over $10,000 in damages. Beware! My car was parked in Los Angeles at the parking lot that I was paying for 6 month (September - February). Came back from overseas trip in February, came to pick up my car to the location only to find out my car was not there. Host did not respond to communication, no help from Neighbor support either. I had to go to Police and claim my car as stolen. 2 weeks later I have received a call from Riverside police officer who told me to come to police tow yard in Riverside to get my car. Apparently, my car has been towed from the parking lot I was paying for. Tow company kept it in tow yard, later sold as junk from auction. When I picked my car it was damaged outside, dents, scratches, worn out tires. Inside was just disgusting. It took me a lot of time and money to make this car drivable again. I had worked with my insurance for few month to get compensated. My car was totaled as a result. My premium gone up. And some of the damages has not been covered. I have also worked with Neighbor.com support, the representative was very human and helpful. Even though it took time, I was able to get full refund for the storage. However, When I wanted to leave negative review for the host, Neighbor.com suppressed my review. It's been over 2 weeks since I published my review and still "under review". Please be aware that platform doesn't do background check on hosts, you can easily get into situation like mine and you will have to deal with it on your own. If I only knew how much of a trouble and damage using Neighbor.com will cause - I would never ever come near this platform.

author: Kevin Whitney
title: Beware… illegal listings
text: I found several listings in my area on neighbor.com that are city street parking spots in residential neighborhoods. This isnt even legal. I would not trust this site if they allow illegal listings.

author: Ka
title: It was a nightmare………………….
text: I was a renter who needed a storage space to store my vehicle and personal belongings. Let me be up-front. My 1st time experience with neighbor.com was absolutely terrible. They touted on their website about their scam prevention with their "multi-layer defense strategy. Measures used include photo ID, phone, and email verification." However, it still failed to do anything to protect me from the scammer, who illegally claimed an abandoned house as his own then listed on the website stating they “just bought this lovely home and is willing to help people out.” First off, neighbors.com did not verify the legal ownership of the property from the scammer; I doubt if they even tried to verify the conditions and the dimensions of the property because the size of the deserted garage space was not as described on the listings when I arrived at the property. From the point when when I met up with the scammer host to arriving at the property, it screamed suspicions in every way. Not only was the property badly deserted and rundown, the garage was also much smaller than what was stated on the website. The scammer simply told me to park at the driveway in front of the garage. The host was very unresponsive and kept making excuses for all the suscupicions I raised to him. However, it was couple days before I left the area, so I had no choice but to stick with the property but I purchased the protection plan from Neighbor at the last minute just in case something bad happened. God forbid, when I returned back to the area, I found out my car was impounded because the son of the real owner (who passed away long time ago) found an unknown vehicle parking inside his dad’s property. I had to go through the headaches, anger and frustrations of trying to get the hold of the scammer, find out where my car was towed, and buy back my car from a shady auction winner out of my own pocket. My car was damaged during the towing and many valuable items were stolen from inside the car. This experience had traumatized me and scarred me permanently. I sincerely hope my experience will be helpful in informing any future customers who consider Neighbor.com.

author: Dennis Kwang
title: The neighbor guarantee is a scam
text: The neighbor guarantee is a scam. I rented a spot from a host that turned out to be a scammer and had my car tolled. Not only did Neighbor not refund me for the cost of the rent but did not cover any damages to my items. After months of frustration with customer service and their insurance provider, there was no resolution. Do not trust!

author: David
title: I’m looking for a spot for winter to…
text: I’m looking for a spot for winter to store my boat I messaged one person an waiting on their reply So Sunday morning around 7-8 arjay  from slc Utah calls me from 1-385-488-2888 saying different things I need to do an he can walk me through the process I said no thanks it was a simple yes or no question I asked I just couldn’t believe this guy called me that early on a Sunday some of us work an like to sleep in on the weekends but I think this made up my mind to probably not use this app if they are that rude an pushy It wasn’t a host it was one of your customer service people the host east fine an said the same thing about you guys

author: PissedNeighbor
title: This app is a scam
text: This app is a scam. All I got was useless inquiries from people asking to live in old RV's in my driveway even though my ad is super clear that I will never allow that. First car that rented my driveway died after not being started for 2 weeks and was a huge pain in the ass to deal with. Neighbor was ZERO help. If someone parks in your driveway you can't touch their car or move it, which means the battery will drain in a week or two and it will not start trapping you and the car. Just plain stupid policies. NOT WORTH THE HEADACHE!

author: u brio
title: A word of warning about using neighbor.com
text: A word of warning about using neighbor.com. It’s an interesting concept, but I’ve found that the hassles are more than any money saved instead of using a commercial storage facility. I found someone near me who had space to rent in a garage. The location was good and the price was good. I was approved to use the space on May 17. I posted a start date of May 24. Neighbor.com's email said the host would be contacting me soon. I never heard from the host, so I contacted him on May 24 about when I could view the space. Several more emails with the host finally produced a meet date. I wasn’t able to see the garage until May 31—two weeks after my approval and one week after my start date. I was surprised when the host told me he worked from home. So he ignored my messages for 2 weeks even though he was available to show it during that time. I decided not to use the space and asked for a refund of my initial payment. I was told I could not get a refund because refunds are only allowed within 1 day after my start date. One day after my start date, I was still waiting to connect with the host.  Now it is a battle of fighting this company via my bank. I’m sure other hosts wouldn’t wait 2 weeks to connect with a customer. So it is the host’s fault in this case, not neighbor.com’s fault. But they aren’t interested in fixing the issue. My hassles with the host are compounded by the hassles of dealing with neighbor.com. As in real life, there are good neighbors and bad neighbors(.com). UPDATE: My bank refunded me the money I spent with Neighbor.com. It was generous of them, but I didn't want them to eat the money. I expected Neighbor.com to give me a refund, but they just kept telling me that I could only get a refund 1 day after my start date. I knew that, but my circumstances didn't fit into their policy. I wasn't asking for a major exception to their rules. I expected good customer service based on the fact that the host never contacted me until a week after my start date. None of this was my fault, except for not being pushy with the host.

author: Mike Flores
title: Total scam and waste of my time
text: Total scam and waste of my time. I had an ‘engineer’ with bad grammar inquiring to rent my garage only to be rude. Of course Neighbor listening only to her side banned me. I won’t rent to people who have nefarious intentions or list with unethical business.

author: MJ
title: I’ve use the service for a year to…
text: I’ve use the service for a year to store a classic car. I lucked out because I found a decent guy that lives alone that cares about the car. That being said, there app is not reliable and doing things as simple as updating your payment method is an exercise in futility.  Their customer service is nonexistent and, if something happens and you miss a payment they send you a text message telling you that they’re going to publicly auction your belongings. I cannot in good faith recommend this app or their platform and if you do decide to use it, do it at your own peril.

author: Chris Nguyen
title: This is not the Airbnb/Uber of Anything but Losing
text: This is not the Airbnb, Uber, of anything. Airbnb and Uber vet their users, on both sides, and step in when there is malice to either user or provider. Neigbor.com DOES NOT. Neighbor.com does not vet the renters on their platform. Anyone with a fake name, email, google number can rent from you. I tried to recover the real name of my renter to pursue legal action and they don't even have that on file and I can't even get ahold of him. A renter rented my space damaged myproperty 3 various times as well as my actual neighbor and Neighbor.com pointed me to their agreements page and said they DO NOT step in or provide any compensation or SERVICES if property is damaged. All the liability is off their backs all they provide is the 'PLATFORM'  which connects renters and hosts. This leads to scammers, disagreements, property damage, and lost revenue to hosts. I would not recommend this app to anyone. It is better to create your own agreement that you both can sign and it protects the host and their property. Be Aware Updated: These guys will say "I'm sorry" ,"We're working on it" , "We're trying to get better" . THEY AREN'T and the hundreds upon thousand of people who reviewed them on FB and here agree. This is the same as uber such that Uber had to see murders in cars, women being sexually harassed, and drivers mistreated before they started doing something. Sadly, the same will happen here. Don't let it something like that happen on your property or family. #DELETENEIGHBORAPP

author: Tadgh B
title: I was almost finished with the host sign up process
text: I was almost finished with the host sign up process on the app and then I thought I better read the legal documents first. I read the TOS first and boy am I glad that I did. This company claims to protect you the host with a million dollar liability policy but in reality you are on your own. I suggest every one read the TOS before doing business with this company.

author: Brad Diggans
title: Beware Scammers Everywhere
text: Scammers Everywhere I listed a garage on this app a few weeks ago.  I started to get responses pretty quickly.  Most requested to contact me out of the app which is the first red flag. Person tried to rent garage 3 months paid in advanced and mailed me a check.  Thought I was protecting myself by having them prepay.  Check comes in but its for more than rent amount.  The person explained that he needed me to deposit the full check and send funds to a shipping company. I waited until the check cleared and funds were approved in my account and went to pay the shipping company but their main form of payment was PayPal or Venmo.  Figured that the check was cleared already so sent the shipping money via Venmo as I have paid other service providers this way in the past. After payment I get email that says the person can no longer rent as the job he was to take was no longer available.  At this point I know its a scam.  Person requests refund but I can keep $200 for my troubles. I call my bank and they said the original check could be cancelled up to 5 days after deposit.  I told the person i would give him a refund after the 5th day and he started to threaten me with reporting me and cancelling the check proving my point of waiting to the 5th day.   Scammer used the name of Bryan Christopher.  Email of bryanchristopher325@gmail and phone number of 513-982-0028. Was contacted next day through Neighbor again with similar scam.  Person trying to pay 3 months upfront but this time it was a lawyer fee.  I will tear up the check when/if it comes.

author: Alejandro
title: Absolutely terrible
text: Absolutely terrible.  They obviously do not screen their Hosts as other bad reviews have mentioned.  I Stored my RV with a Host and made a side deal with Host to stay night 1 day a week.  We had a falling out & I decided to move out due to her constant manipulation & lies.  In her texts (on neighbor.com text app) she admitted that we had made this side deal.  Her thought was to get back at me, so I wouldnt be able to stay one night a week by saying in text that “I just found out from Neighbor.com that I could not have you staying even 1 night a week”.  Eli at Neighbor.com decided to remove me from App due to violation of rules.  Ok, thats cool, whatever, but Host violated rules as well.  She admitted to it on their platform!   I could care less about getting booted from such a chintzy site, but I know that Host would care and she didnt get booted.  Eli then said “it was due to my behaviour, regarding texts on platform.  I know for a fact I didnt curse or anything like that.  All I did was state the facts that she was manipulative and a liar.  Pretty much like this review.  Will I now be booted from "Trustpilot"?  I asked him what exactly I said that was offensive & he said “we have already given you our reasoning”,  pretty much blowing me off.  I also wanted to leave a bad review for her as I had gas stolen from my RV at Host spot but now that I am taken off platform, I cannot.  Host specifically stated in add that it was a safe place to store vehicles.  Other tenants should be aware right?  Eli’s response was basically “meh, whatever”.  I can tell you what is going on here.  Neighbor.com makes money off of the Hosts, so of course they didnt want to research problem & come to obvious conclusion that the Host is the “only” one that should of been booted from platform.  Terrible business, stay away! I am now responding to Neighbor.com's response on "Trustpilot".  These people are unbelievable.  Their response is basically a bunch of blah blah blah, just filling in space with words to show that they responded.  They count on most people not making the effort of reading it and actually understanding that they really are not saying anything.  I have been repeatedly told about their terms of service when I bring up facts like, the Host violated the rules and there is proof.  How does repeating "that" answer the fact that they did not penalize her?  I also keep telling them that she admitted to making this agreement of one night a week with me "ON THEIR PLATFORM"!!  And they keep saying that "we communicated outside of platform".  No it isn't and I have the proof!  They just go ahead and ignore me when I say that.  That is what is called "Gaslighting".  The bottom line is, nobody cares about their concerns about blah blah blah terms and agreements.  This is what real people are concerned with( the truth!).  The host made the side deal with me and there is unequivical proof of that, and that she admitted to it on the platform.  Neighbor.com are masters of Gaslighting and ignoring the obvious and only care about the money.  Again, they didnt want to kick her off the site for breaking their rules because they make the money off of "her".  Plain and simple.  They dont want to admit to that because in the end, even though they make money off of the Host, "NOBODY" makes any money without the tenant.  So Gaslighting and creating confusion is all they really have in order to have people believe that they dont treat the "tenants" in this business transaction terrible.  In summation, Neighbor.com's business practice is officially to take the hosts side at any costs in a dispute between Host and Tenant because that is where the money comes from.  Removing me from app also kept me from giving host bad review on Neighbor.com on her bizarre behaviour and that "no" it is not a safe spot to keep your vehicle as my full tank of gas was stolen on RV.

author: Lena Li
title: Thank you neighbor for ruining a 2 year old car!
text: Sounds like a good idea in practice but it’s pretty clear that the hosts are not vetted. Left a  barely 2 year old car in pristine condition in a “garage” for 1.5 years since I decided to temporarily relocate due to Covid. Ultimately I had my car shipped to me since I would not be returning and it arrived covered in leaves and dirt several inches thick along the windshield. There were even cigarette butts under the wipers. There were leaves and dirt inside of the ventilation. The host clearly didn’t store the car in a garage otherwise there is no way it would be covered in leaves and dirt. The host even had the audacity to charge me to “clean” my car halfway through the storage period. After I thoroughly cleaned the car of all the debris I realized that the paint on the car had become so damaged that it was no longer even glossy. You could see the stains from being constantly rained on until the paint became damaged. It would cost thousands of dollars to fix. Even though I had paid for an indoor garage storage he had stored it outside the majority of my he time causing significant damage to the exterior of the car. I’m devastated by what the host has done to my car. Neighbors response to this was that they wouldn’t do anything. Thank you neighbor for causing my nearly new car thousands of dollars worth of damage!

author: Teyo Jerge
title: Insurance blowoff
text: Vehicle damaged while stored, payments going to Neighbor. The validity of the Insurance claim was cut and dry, confirmed/agreed by the host. Neighbors response has been a run around and lack of response while car was undrivable. Handled it myself. Two months later I receive an email from their insurance company, informing me Neighbor is requesting some sort of fraud investigation. In order to process the claim. If an insurance claim becomes necessary expect Neighbor to complicate, avoid, or resist any way possible, while occasionally sending professional sounding redirects and avoidant communications rather than take any sort of effective meaningful action in alignment with their marketing that suggests they are insured and trustworthy. For example…..

author: helmut koch
title: Stay Away!
text: Although the concept behind the neighbors storage app seems like a good idea, in practice it is seriously flawed and untrustworthy. There are just too many dishonest people out there, both hosts and renters, that make use of this service an exercise in frustration and futility. I have been scammed twice by hosts who advertised  storage areas they did not own or that were public parking lots. The screening process appears to be very superficial to nonexistent, and the people who run the app do not seem to care. It’s an extreme example of buyer/renter beware and the time and effort one has to expend to make sure a rental space is legitimate is not worth it. I will never use this service again and I warn anyone who is contemplating using it to stay clear and far away!

author: Adam Natoma
title: Dishonest theived
text: They continue to debit your account stealing your money even after you have cancelled their service

author: Chris Nguyen
title: As with many people on this website I…
text: As with many people on this website I too have tried to contact neighbor support dozens of times and they take at least a week to respond each time. An open issue took 6 weeks to resolve. They also do not care about the hosts and do not back up their hosts if renters go awry. I would not feel safe renting my space in this site.

author: Teyo Jerge
title: Valid insurance claim verified by…
text: Valid insurance claim verified by renter and host received the run around and the dust off. The insurance coverage is just a marketing tool, they have no intention of actually using it, regardless of the validity of the claim. Post Neighbor reply. Exactly!! “Team will always do whatever they can”. Could you be more general or vague, they’ve done nothing. I’ve already reached out to you, by website and email. You have my name, you have the claim, you have the host who was present and took pictures of the damage. Then re-direct me to read about the “guarantee” on your website. This folks is what a professional corporate run around looks like. Still no response directly, but they have time to post empty words here, then suggest I reach out and review their website. It was cut and dry covered, damage from attempted theft while paying Neighbor monthly for storage. The “ team” was non responsive with the exception of our host, who completely agreed the damage was clearly covered.

author: Michael Batista
title: vehicle stolen from a neighbor host
text: I had my vehicle stolen from a neighbor host and neighbor has refused to make me whole financially. My now spotless insurance claim history has a big fat total loss claim on it for the next 5 years that my PREMIUMS will be higher due to this total loss claim. This amount of money spread over the next 5 years will only be enough to cover my PREMIUM INCREASES. Not only am I out the deductible, but I am out the every single month for the premium increase for the next 5 years. ******EDITED ON 12/8/2021 TO REFLECT UPDATE TO NEIGHBOR's RESPONSE****** Hello Michael, Thank you for your recent follow up with the unfortunate situation with your vehicle.We understand the frustration that this has caused you. We have worked diligently to assist you in your loss and help in any way we could to create a swift resolution. We were pleased to hear that your insurance was able to make you whole and provide you with coverage in your primary claim. Per our terms of service, our renter protection is a secondary coverage and therefore in this situation; because you were covered fully under your policy with Geiko, there is no further coverage that is offered through Neighbor. Allie spoke with you on July 12th and from that time, we were waiting on your response. Many months have passed without communication from you. Now in November, you are contacting us requesting a settlement, but as far as our terms of service, we are not liable to cover any further claim. We certainly do sympathize with how difficult this must have been for you and have removed this host from our platform. As stated before, we are pleased to hear that your loss was covered under your primary insurance and hope that has allowed you to move forward. We strive to create a safe and positive experience for both our hosts and renters and are most disappointed that your experience was not reflective of that. Best wishes to you in your future endeavors. Best, Trust & Safety Neighbor Note to the community: The settlement requested was a meager $5,000 to cover the cost of my This amount of money spread over the next 5 years will only be enough to cover my PREMIUM INCREASES for the total loss claim, and pay for my deductible.  I wasn't asking for an unreasonable amount of funds.  Just enough to make me financially whole for the next 5 years I'll be out every single month from Neighbor's negligence by allowing (at the time of the incident) people on their platform without even performing a background check.  This is not my fault and I should not be held responsible for their host's actions. In this case, theft.  I should not be made an example of.

author: Don White
title: Stayed 5 days got charged 3 months
text: Stayed 5 days got charged 3 months. Had problem with thier website trying to verify my email account and kept on getting rejected so I had to call cancel my service.  Apparently that doesn't work, you have to use the website to cancel. Called customer service absolutely no help whatsoever.

author: Diane Pfundstein
title: I received no response regarding the…
text: I received no response regarding the rental I requested after attempting contact 4 times. I think this is a scam. They said you usually hear from this owner of the rental area within three hours but no response from her either. YET They want to know why I haven’t gone through with my reservation!

author: Joanne Morris
title: If it would accept zero stars
text: If it would accept zero stars, I would have chosen zero.  I rented a space for my travel trailer and was scheduled to move my trailer. The day before I was to move it, I had to put my truck in the repair shop. I tried to call Neighbor to cancel my reservation but you get voice mail.  I waited a day and tried to call again.  This happened two more times. I began to email them and no response. After the fourth email, I received a cancellation. The cancellation happened to be after the next rental payment was due. I have tried repeatedly to contact customer service but that doesn`t happen. I am dunned several times a day with an email for a payment that is not due. Stay as far away as possible from this company.

author: Brian Chojnacki
title: My car was stolen while using this app
text: My car was stolen while using this app. Luckily, I filed a police report and was able to get my car back. Neighbor did absolutely nothing to go above and beyond to fix this situation as the only thing I received was my money back from using the app. I would highly recommend you stay away from using their service not only for the safety of your property but because of the moral ethics of this company.

author: Rebecca
title: Charged for a Cancelled Reservation
text: This company scammed me out of $81, constantly trying to charge my credit card. So I made other arrangements and understood I could not get my initial fee of $40 that I paid for the first month’s of the parking space. Ok, no problem. I cancelled with the owner of the space I was supposed to be renting and also via the app. I was also given a brief survey of why I was cancelling. All proof that I cancelled my reservation successfully. A month later(I always lock my credit card for security reasons), I get a notification by email stating neighbor tried to charge me $81 for my rental space that had been cancelled a month ago. I sent in the proof via email to support along with all the screenshots. Apparently, my reservation hadn’t been cancelled? That makes no sense because I had screenshots proving otherwise sent though that email. Several days in, their system continued to try and charge my card. Unfortunately around the time I was checking out at a store, they managed to steal the $81. I immediately emailed customer service with the same screenshots, demanding a response. Again, my reservation had been cancelled and I had proof. Funny, because they continuously  kept emailing me and were able to get ahold of me quite easily every single time they tried to charge my card and yet when I asked for a refund, customer service never responded back(it had been several days now). I contacted via phone, demanding a manger or supervisor. The woman refused that I could speak to either and simply said she would send this over to a refund team, mark it as urgent and I would hear from them in a couple of days. It has been over a week now. I have also continuously tried to get in contact once more with customer support via email. No response. This company will scam you out of your money. I’m out $80 for a reservation that was cancelled a month ago. It’s not even about the money. It’s how negligent and childish they are being, ignoring all the proof I have that it had been cancelled.

author: Crystal
title: Terrible customer service/no help
text: This company is terrible if someone damages your property that will not help you they told me that even though a renter has destroyed the side of my home it took them 3 days to tell me message us on our social media since the links for help do not work they tell me we have a 1 million dollar policy that does not cover property damage that I would have to go through my insurance I’m completely floored they put it back on the homeowner and wash their hands. Don’t let your property get damaged they will not help you good luck I am done with these people
