author: Dennis Kwang
title: Don't use neighbor
text: Unfortunately, I got scammed by the host and had my car towed. What is even worse is that there are things missing from my car and I have tried filing a claim with neighbor.com only to be met with silence. Not professional and their guarantee is a scam.

author: John Dalton
title: Beware of scam postings!
text: I signed up for neighbor so I could rent a parking space for 1 month while my mother in law stayed with us to help with our newborn. Sadly, upon going to pick up my car I discovered the host I had rented with had falsely claimed ownership of the parking space and my car was towed. Now I’m stuck with a $535 bill to recover my car. Additionally the police say the only thing they can do is hold the host accountable for the $25 I paid for the parking space which isn’t worth the time or the headache. This alone would not cause me to write a one star review, the reason I am putting this out there is despite my 2 voice mails and 1 email to their support team I have yet to hear back from Neighbor. Also, after making several attempts to call them I have found that neighbor has turned of the phones and is not answering live calls. All of them get sent to voicemail.  It’s been a week now since sending my email so hopefully they do eventually get back to me, if they do I will be sure to update this review.

author: Ashley Fender
title: NEIGHBOR APP SCREWED ME OVER
text: Poor service. I was overcharged the amount agreed upon, and Neighbor refuses to refund me. In addition to that, the employee told me to cancel my membership with the host and did not inform me that 1) it would automatically expire despite my having already overpayed for an entire month of service just three days ago and 2) I would lose insurance. Then the employee had the nerve to call me back and place blame instead of coming up with solutions. EXTREMELY POOR SERVICE. Just pay a real storage site instead of people that cannot do their job.

author: Troy Garner
title: I’ve been renting storage space on…
text: I’ve been renting storage space on neighbor for about a year I’m ready to retrieve my items but I can’t find my host information to contact them - my conversation area is blank in the app - I’ve reached out to neighbor several times for assistance to help me somehow contact my host but to date neighbor hasn’t done anything to assist except send Emails telling me to check my conversations in the app - I’ve tried everything to get my things back - neighbors support doesn’t work no one answers their phone number either They’re the worst !!!!!! They have no problem taking payment from my credit card every month -but when it’s move out time they don’t know anything they can’t connect me with my host again??? Really!!! I wouldn’t recommend this app to my worst enemy SMFH!!!!! Troy

author: Noel Crockett
title: SCAMMING CON ARTISTS…
text: I booked a storage reservation on Neighbor.com for the same day. I got a deal for $43 a month. I thought, wow this is fantastic! Well then I got a message saying I had to wait up to 48 hours to be approved by the host,and that I needed  to write the host a good reason why they should approve me. Ok well that held up my scheduled tow truck, but whatever. I didn't read the fine print so I wait for approval. The host approves me for my monthly payment  of $43 and the money is taken from my account. I book a tow truck and the tow guy asks me for the drop off address. Well I pull up the reservation and the address doesn't have the street name only the street number and zip code. I contact the host several times without a response, so I made other storage arrangements.  Then later that afternoon the host finally responds to me. Now keep in my mind my Reservation was set for the prior day. Well I ask the host to cancel my reservation, and he tells me that he can't bcz neighbor will charge him a $60 fee. I sent several emails to neighbor, and still to this day (a month later) they have not replied to my cancelation request. And every day they attempt to charge my account in various different amounts. I have to cancel my card because they won't stop attempting to take money from me. Don't give this company your card information. As far as I can tell, it's a scam ran by some people who are tech savvy, and know how to manipulate search engine traffic.

author: Brian Tietjens
title: Horrible company
text: Horrible company. Very deceptive business practice. Beware of their 50% off deal for the first month! They find a way to bill your credit card for it. CROOKS - STAY AWAY - VERY DISHONEST.

author: FamBam
title: Storage, not a Living Space!
text: Host Review-I like the way that host and client are connected and everything is through the app. However, I noticed that within potential clients, there are many who want to live on the storage site rather then “store or park” their items. We didn’t expect what we experienced, people trying to live on our property.

author: Spicy Dan
title: Neighbor IGNORED me then STOLE all the money
text: I registered Neighbor with my passport ID a couple months ago and got my spaces rent out, however, Stripe asked for my SSN which I don't have so they refused to pay me even though my spaces were fully reserved for at least 2 months. I sent them email (both Neighbor and Stripe)  about how to fix it, turned out they ignored my email for an entire week and secretly removed all my listings and payment history, which means I can't get paid and all my earnings are gone. Here's the entire story: At the signing up part, I used my passport ID to register and manually get approved by the specialist they sent me, it means I can list my space and get paid already, I was not required to provide SSN at all. then Stripe asked for my SSN for identity all of a sudden near payment date and used it to pause the payment, I kept sending emails saying I don't have it yet and my passport photo ID was already a solid proof of my identity but no reply from either of them. Today when I checked Neighbor app, ALL my earning records and listings are gone. I just want to say, at the beginning they were like super active and friendly to urge me providing information to sign up by endless texting and calling..... and now they totally ignore me just because a tiny issue and STEAL my earnings, absolutely disgusting what they did!!! In case anyone who read this and a lawyer, is that a fraud?

author: Henry Davis
title: Just another Negative review this time…
text: Just another Negative review this time as a HOST...(I wrote with a pseudo name to not be followed home at night by a NEIGHBOR enforcement officer) BUSINESS ANALYSIS of NEIGHBOR This outline is of a deeper analysis of the NEIGHBOR  BUSINESS PRACTICES written by a HOST within the public services provided under the published Terms and Conditions of NEIGHBOR. This is a very short treatise/outline on the business model NEIGHBOR  ostensibly used in establishing their business. This writing is in no way advocating the use or non-use of this service.  I am not an employee of NEIGHBOR or its affiliates or its parent organization. 1) Great idea, lead to, 2) Build on the AirBnb model, resulting in, 3) Start-up with lack of detailed analysis of "in fault" potential issues, thus, 4) Using the "Build the business in progress" model (read on the fly), 5) Development and release of the online application (read before someone else does) breeds commerce without staffing, policies to manage the surge of contracts (read hosts and buyers), breeding, 6) PROBLEMS and lots of them, creating, 7) Cash flow imbalance of income versus the cost of customer service staffing and training, documented procedures for a multitude of issues (read overwhelmed), resulting in, 8) Negative host and buyer feedback to the level of 47% (must extrapolate for those that didn't write reviews), creating a need for, 9) Solutions within chaos. A brilliant idea cannot flourish within chaos.  Only by disciplined following of the below recommendations will the business recover quickly versus a lengthy and painful "on the fly" approach. THE PATH FORWARD: ... The last paragraph in this information is a complaint from a customer,  not me, but, points out the "hole" in the NEIGHBOR business model. I actually have the same problem so I copied this person's well written review. "I'm a pretty patient person, but this company does not care...at all. No one ever picks up the phone. You'll get a response after days of emailing them without a resolution, so you have to email them again and wait over a week. I'm currently waiting on a response on a time sensitive situation and it's been over a week, no one has gotten back to me. Customer service is non-existent."

author: KG
title: bummer  experience
text: I found storage on the app. Gave a credit card. Then they sent a message that the storage was not available. 5 days later they have not credited back my card. My big beef is they don't let you see where the storage is located before committing. At least show me the neighborhood. Disapointed and waiting for a refund.

author: Wayne Sun
title: I don't know if this a joke or scam
text: I don't know if this a joke or scam. I need a car storage so I submitted inquiries - no answer. Then I sent requests which needed to know my credit card information. After I gave my information and sent the requests, I got no response at all, even though on the website said their average response time are all 6 hours! I had to cancel all my requests the next day. Now I'm waiting to see if they're going to charge my credit card. The website also ask you to leave feedback. That's a joke, too. You cannot see any feedback you or someone else left for the space owners. Totally waste of time, if it's not a scam!

author: Tom T
title: The Worst
text: The Worst. Run Now. The host cancelled on me and Neighbor will not stop charging me. Customer service doesn't respond to anything. The cancellation on my end doesn't go through. I have to have my credit card company fight it for me now. Even their customer survey only lets you click 10/10 lol.

author: liam tobin
title: Stay away!!!!!
text: No customer service. My host left the business. Neighbor’s one and only response was to just cancel online. Still charged me then charged me $25 late fee. Can’t get a human. Can’t get an email answered. Total scam. STAY AWAY. More negative reviews than positive look for yourself.

author: samuel

author: Wayne Hammer Hampton
title: POOR, CHARGE MY CARD AFTER MOVING OUT!
text: My experience was very poor. First the rental space was advertised 20' x 20'garage, but was actually 10' x 20'. So I let the renter know I would stay but I would move after 1/2 price month. Because I need that amount of space as advertised. After pay 1st month 1/2 price and moving out 2day before the next month, I was charged another payment. Call & text support no answer or response, until I went through Bank proceeds for refund. Now you say that I have to continue staying there to get 1st month 1/2 price. Where does it say that anywhere. Fraud, refund me my money you took off my card after I clearly move out before the new month began. Oh yea I see you corrected the dimensions now.

author: Nick
title: Total scam
text: The idea behind Neighbor.com is good. Yet, the execution is poor. Hosts don’t see the money for a month after the tenant moves in.  They charge hosts and tenants fees, collectively it’s about 30% of monthly rent. Imaging giving $1000 every month out of your $3000 rent to the realtor who found you a house to live in!? That’s absurd. It’s an information service, should not cost more that 3-5% monthly or 50% once off. They flood Google with their ads, so their ad will be the first one you see when searching for a parking space. But when a new tenant contacts the property, they actually think they communicate directly to the property. They have no idea there is some stupid neighbor involved. In addition, their customer service is no where to be found if the tenant or host have problems, but they will chase you like vicious dogs if you decide to cancel your space. Or if your are a host, they will abandon the trailer if the tenant stops paying. They will charge the tenant an additional month at the end, yet the host will not see those money. They keep it!?! This company is a total scam.

author: Anthony Vestal
title: BEWARE
text: BEWARE Bad Idea Reserved means purchased. (Neighbor special lingo) I reserved a spot, never moved in and cancelled 3 days later. The fee was supposed to be like $73.00, I was fine with them keeping it, but then they charged me an additional $73.00 because I didn't rent for 2 months.  So I asked if they where re renting the space and they said I "canceled" ( which means moved out) in the neighbor special lingo. and have no rights to the space even though they charged me a full months rent. It's a scam and they pick and choose what words mean. support was useless contacted me a week and a half later. Yeah reserved means reserved And 3 days should be pro rated Scam I reserved another spot before this one and they cancelled after they took my money.  therefore it's not permanent till move in. I never moved in. Why not explain on the original page instead of bait and switch? I was out of town and in a position of desperation. And after the first cancellation from the renter. (So how was the first renter able to cancel?) this was the only space to put my semi. Explain that. After I looked at a space the app took back to the begining. Starting over through the listing. Frustrating You know your wrong.

author: Anonymous Reviewer
title: Unauthorized Scheduled Payments
text: This service is a great idea, HOWEVER my personal experience has not been. PLEASE BEWARE!!! I don't believe this company has the manpower nor the systems of communication, app usability, customer service or screening processes locked in enough to provide a safe, secure, dependable service.  Here are my story's significant points that may help people who dare to use this service in the future or are considering it: #1 I needed a space to store my car for a couple months. I sent in a reservation request to a host that ultimately was "Declined -Space Unavailable." My card was charged but I received a refund a few days later. HOWEVER, due to my investigations online about prior users' reviews and how Neighbor still charged user's cards after a reservation was canceled, I checked my Neighbor account today just in case. Although I never used the Space, the request was denied, and I got a refund, my Neighbor account has my debit card set to take out a "scheduled" $65.53 from my account for August 1, 2021!!! Really?!! Now I have to email them again and I'll get to the part about customer service and trying to reach them... #2 So, I reserved another space that was Available, the reservation was approved and my card was charged. The host didn't have their storage address on their profile. I received the address after I reserved the space. I went on Google Maps to check out the parking garage and the area it was in. Then I looked at where my car would be and I didn't feel secure leaving it there AND when I messaged my host after the reservation was approved to tell them my drop off plans and ask a question the host sent me an automated response which didn't answer my question. I ultimately did not feel secure about the reservation or my ability to communicate with the host so I canceled my reservation and received a refund a few days later. Low and behold, that is also showing up now on my Neighbor account as a "Scheduled" payment for $144.13 for September 1, 2021!!! Really??? Omg...so I have 2 scheduled payments on my card coming up for two spaces that I never used, were canceled and received refunds for! #3 I called their customer phone line and there is no one to speak to there, ever. I have tried several times. Good luck with that! I just had to ask them a simple question.. "Do I have to pay a whole month's rent if I only end up using a space for a couple days out of that month? I couldn't get a hold of someone live over the phone, so I Emailed them instead. They FINALLY responded 16 days later, apologizing for their delay and promising to improve (as you will see again and again if you read the other reviews on here). They said I would have to pay rent for the whole month. #5 After my experience so far, I have to spend my time writing a review to warn other people about this mess of a business and to express to Neighbor, since this seems to be the best place to actually get a response from them in a timely manner, and to state that I MAY have to report them to the BBB if they don't resolve those "Scheduled" future payments, PERMANENTLY. Not only that, now I have to keep an eye on my Neighbor app to make sure they actually don't schedule even more future payments after they resolve the ones that are scheduled now! This has been a huge headache for me, has taken up so much of my time, and is causing me so much stress. #6 My final feelings are that I am never going to use this service in the future, I won't recommend it, and I am so grateful to all the other people who have taken the time to write a review because those reviews prepared me for what to expect in my experience. Thank you reviewers!! And finally, if you want security with your payments, your belongings, etc. I would NOT use Neighbor. Shell out that extra dough to make sure you don't have to worry about all this drama AND please read the rest of the reviews on here and anywhere else you can find them. You may thank yourself in the future. I know I am. Now I have to take more of my time to write them another email with screenshots and wait for them to resolve these scheduled payments, which will probably take another 16 DAYS or more like the last time I emailed them. AND!!! My headache won't be over. I will still have to check back in to my app to make sure that they resolved scheduled payments permanently. Extremely unpleasant,  stressful experience! Today I should be sitting in the sun enjoying the 4th of July weekend, yet here I am writing this review. Totally disappointing.

text: I've been trying to get a Refund from 2 separate units since last month.... NEVER received a refund....nobody answers the phone, email or text but they will act concerned HERE but will do absolutely NOTHING. They take your money without any services... STAY AWAY!!!

author: JoAnn Schultz
title: Abandoned house & zero response
text: I contacted my host 24 hours in advance to coordinate a move in time. No response. I left a voicemail and sent an email to customer service. No response. So I went to the hosts address on move-in day. No one was there. The house looked abandoned. I sent more emails and voicemails to customer service. No response. If they took my deposit, then I want it back. Worst service ever. Buyer beware.

author: T E
title: Just Terrible
text: I signed up for storage on Neighbors.  It was even a "Instantly Verified Guaranteed" listing.  I was 100%  depending on this storage as I am new to the area and have more vehicles than can be stored on my property.  After paying and not hearing from the owner I asked a real neighbor if I could use their driveway as an emergency.  I waited for my rented space owner to contact me and was not contacted an messages ignored.  I then messaged that I was going to move something to my spot and sure enough the owner then quickly replied but claimed he did not "finish" signing up to rent the space through Neighbors and he did not know how Neighbors got his info.  Likely story.  Meanwhile you CANNOT CONTACT LIVE SUPPORT ON NEIGHBORS.  Their customer service number drops your call and makes you email them, when you email them they take forever to reply, not the same day.  So I was left with no answers, no support, my boat in someone else's driveway with no place to store it.  On the Gulf of Mexico where there not no affordable options.  When Neighbors support finally replied they were useless and offered no explanation or support.

author: Don Summers
title: A totally useless app!!!
text: I tried 4 times to rent a space in Phoenix, AZ to store a car, all 4 were unresponsive after 36 hours! I understand people are busy but if you sign up to provide service then provide those services or delete your ad. I would give zero stars if possible, I tried to call neighbor.com and after 5 minutes on hold, they tell me there is no one to answer my call( it done during their listed business hours , mid day). A completely useless app!!!

author: Jacob
title: It was fraud!!!
text: It was fraud! Someone just posted an address on Neighbor so I could store my rv. Once I pulled up totally different people asked me to move because they had never heard of neighbor. And besides the AUTOREPLIES from neighbor support I've heard nothing. I would be very surprised if I am remitted the first month deposit. EDIT: After this review I was refunded my deposit very quickly by Neighbor.com.

author: Josy
title: YOU DO NOT REALLY HAVE A RESERVATION IT IS A LIE.
text: Neighbor charged my credit card, the host message that my space was confirmed... THEN I get text from Karen F. in Salt Lake City, that my reservation is cancelled.  Neighbor said  and I quote "Host has the right to cancel anytime before you show up"  This is not a sustainable business model.  Rent a hotel room, and show up to sleep in it and they can cancel room one minute before you arrive if they get better offer?   BEWARE YOU ARE RESERVING NOTHING!!!!!!!

author: Lisa B.
title: Scammed and can't get in touch with chat
text: My experience with neighbor.com has been a nightmare!! I was so excited to use the storage. I was buying the trailer of my dreams. The day before I bought it I made a storage reservation and got confirmation. The next day I still hadn't received an address. I waited the 24 hours it says the host can respond. Still nothing, I called and got the nobody is available to take your call please try back. I did that about 5 times, then emailed. Still NOTHING. The host put that I moved in. I have not! In fact because of the lack of follow up on neighbor.com my trailer was towed last night. I had to pay to get it out all because I didn't have the storage I paid for. When I look at my reservation it only gives a zip code for the address, something the site should have caught. Very disappointed.

author: Michael Batista
title: AWFUL EXPERIENCE - READ TO BELIEVE!
text: The experience has been absolutely awful, and I blame it almost entirely on Neighbor.com.  The reason I booked on this app is because I was looking for a more affordable long term parking solution because I am traveling outside of the country for 90 days.  The person, Josh Johnson, whom of which I left my vehicle in care of orchestrated a plot to become a Level 4 superhost with absolutely no reviews or prior bookings (how could that possibly be?) and then stole my vehicle. The vehicle was recovered after a thorough investigation. The host has disappeared and fled the area. My vehicle was deemed a total loss. I am now required to pay my deductible, take a total loss hit on my insurance, and will be required to pay a higher insurance premium for 7 years because of this. All because of Neighbor.com allowing this user to become a Superhost level 4 without having ANY bookings or ANY reviews - fact of the matter I find this out after the entire incident. This entire issue would have been avoided if Neighbor.com did proper due diligence on their hosts. A representative from my car insurance states they did a background check on my host and said that they wouldn't have lent him a pair of socks. Literally the worst experience of my life. I am so disappointed and in disbelief how something like this could have happened to begin with.

author: William McC
title: Two negative experiences with Neighbor
text: Two negative experiences with Neighbor. First time I put a deposit on a garage space, the owner ghosted me. Eventually I asked fir a refund and got it days later. The second experience, the garage owner requested a deposit via Zelle. I complied, and Neighbor blocked my account from access, and the garage owner turned out to not own or have rights to the space Neighbors offered to me. Neighbors is a good idea, but poorly executed. My recourse with Neighbors is limited to FAQ, and nothing else save this request for reviews!

author: Ron C
title: They take your money and don’t respond…
text: They take your money and don’t respond to any of your questions or requests. Very unprofessional and unorganized. I tried multiple times over 3 days and got frustrated and canceled my reservation.

author: Wayne Skalka
title: Ask to see before you rent they will not refund you if it not as advertised!
text: I used neighbor for to store a camper the description said it was a locked gate for the storage when i went to go move in found there is no gate and no lock you basically were parking on the street.  I cancelled the reservation but they still charged me and wont refund my money.  I suggest you stay away from this app its bad news and you will be out money.

author: Norah O
title: Avoid! Forced to vacate mid-rental while out-of-state.
text: Avoid using this service - no guarantees! You may need to suddenly remove your belongings - even if you have paid. If you're not local at that moment, you need to hire movers or risk losing your items. I rented a space and outlined my timeline. The storage owner used shipping containers on his property, but apparently he shouldn't have been doing this because the city asked him to remove the containers. I was 6 months into my rental, the owner told me I had 30 days to move. Note - I always paid on time. I explained that I was out-of-state for a few months, which I had communicated this in the beginning. So now I need to spend hundreds of dollars to have movers come and move my belongings elsewhere. I should have just used a traditional storage unit provider rather than trying to support a local person. I spent $300+ to have people unlock my storage unit and move to another. At least with a typical storage unit provider, your items are safe and no one is going to ask you to move your things while you're 3,000 miles away.

author: Mike F
title: Neighbor.com $1M Host Guarantee not cover theft by renter
text: Neighbor.com $1M Host Guarantee not cover theft by renter. Neighbor.com does not respect and take user complaints seriously and should not be awarded an IPO to enrich themselves with billions of undeserved dollars.  I advertised garage space on the Neighbor.com  platform and instead user resorts to name calling and other abuses.  Many scams exhibit poor English and this user had all the red flags including claiming to be a Software Engineer.  Neighbor dismissed my complaint: 'After reviewing this case with our Trust and Safety team, we do not have any reason to believe --- has any nefarious intentions.  She is simply trying to store her vehicle.' Furthermore,  their $1M Host guarantee does not cover if renter steals equipment from landlord's garage claiming 'The Guarantee is not a replacement for the law and we would assist authorities with their investigation if this situation were to arise.' Ever try recovery from police in USA?  Neighbor refuses to provide renter's full name, address and phone depriving landlord to sue in court and collections to recover from renter stealing garage equipment and tools in the thousands of dollars. Neighbor.com is no AirBnB.  Don't waste your time with Neighbor.com and risk your garage and property.

author: suzy
title: The website scanned my card but could…
text: The website scanned my card but could not pick up the CR-V and did not tell me where to put it I hope they didn't charge my card I could not contact anyone very bad service website not working

author: John A
title: Do not trust this site
text: Do not trust this site. They claim there is no charge until you are approved and the host contacts you. No one ever contacted me and they charged my card immediately. Unresponsive and not at all concerned about keeping their word. It is a scam. Don't fall for it.

author: Cameron
title: Charged without even using the space
text: Horrible experience with Neighbor. You have to make a reservation before being able to see the space to rent. They then charge you for the space even after you finally see it and decide it doesn’t fit your needs. When you contact them about a refund they say you agreed to their terms upon making a reservation and it’s out of their hands. Bad customer service. UPDATE: turns out Neighbor charged me $69 a month after I cancelled the reservation. Not only did they charge me before even seeing the spot, they also charged me another month’s rent at a place I cancelled and never even used.

author: Brenda Williams
title: ZERO STARS
text: ZERO STARS. Neighbor charge me an extra month for the storage unit. Neither neighbor and the storage unit were able to solve my problem and refund my money. Neighbor said that they paid the storage, so they should take care of the refund. On the other hand, the storage unit said that they never got the money. I wouldn’t recommend any of these business. And if you need a storage unit, reach them out directly, so you don’t have the same headache I had! EDIT: BUT the problem is that the storage said that they never got the money. Someone is lying in this whole story.

author: Valerie Ma
title: Took our money/no service...is this legal???
text: I'm sorry to hear about Cleo's experience.  We were scheduled to store our van in an attached garage in Wichita at the home of Justin B for at least 6 months, starting in August 2019. At the last minute, Justin B said we would have to leave our van "outside" for him to park in the garage because he had forgotten it was full of his mom's stuff which he needed to clean out. We immediately replied thanks but no thanks and found another storage. In November, we noticed monthly charges to our credit card for the full amount we would have paid had Justin B actually had the garage available at agreed upon time.  I immediately called neighbor.com customer service and spoke to Katherine, who cancelled future automatic payments, but REFUSED TO ISSUE A REFUND TO US for the $226.76 they took out of our credit card on the grounds that they had already paid Justin B with our money.  The fact that it was not our fault meant nothing. She merely said we needed to chase down Justin B and convince him to give it back to us...REALLY??? What kind of business would do that to their customers? Is that even legal???  With no other option, we reached out to Justin B who promptly replied that he had, in fact, received the money.  He said he "just noticed that!" and said he would pay it back right away via a payment app. Days went by and no money came through. I checked with him again in November and then again in December.  By the last contact, he indicated he needed that money and would try to pay it back in a week.  That was 24 days ago and to date, we have not received a dime.

author: cleo
title: renters beware....irresponsible and ungrateful
text: i found a storage rental place for my oversize vehicle via Neighbor.com, by which i was ripped off $140 of my last month rent with the help of neighbor.com via their misleading information/impression about THEIR onsite host (as representing Neighbor.com) that was stealing customers from them by telling customers to cancel payment ($86.72) made on neighbor.com but pay him, the onsite host, cash, directly and also the storage rental owner cash directly monthly, instead of making their monthly payment via neighbor.com like they were supposed to, which was supposed to give customers insurance for their properties stored.  the piece of misleading info & impression given  by neighbor.com caused my trust misplaced with two untrustworthy people that ended up ripping me off $140 cash. (one of which happened to appear to represent neighbor.com)  while it was advertised on neighbor.com as having 24/7 access, the storage owner made me wait five hours before i could get my vehicle off his lot.  by the time i got there, my vehicle remained in the same spot unmoved with a bunch of other vehicles blocking it, gate locked, bull dog running loose on the lot.  i barely got my vehicle out of the lot.  neighbor.com refused to take any responsibility at all for this. this is how they thanked me for helping them stop one of their onsite hosts from stealing customers from them.  i'm yet to receive my $86.72 refund from them. renters beware...their onsite host can screw u over and doesn't work for them, thereby, neighbor.com will not be responsible if u ever get ripped off believing that u were following the instructions of neighbor.com even when neighbor.com aided in the misleading info that gave out a false sense of security for doing business with storage owners found on neighbor.com.  you're at the mercy of the storage owner and the mercy of THEIR onsite hosts.  just hope and pray that they don't rip u off like the ones that did to me. and be sure that u get in writing everything promised before u pay anything to anyone.  i think that b/c of my brain injury and my PTSD besides having a widow's brain, i got duped, left my vehicle with them with no proper paperwork stating the nature of my vehicle on the lot but a piece of paperwork for auto repair stating the monthly charge but not a receipt for the $140 the storage owner received. as a response to your response underneath, u guys could have done more, i.e. giving me the $140 storage owner owes me b/c your onsite host was the reason why i trusted storage owner  b/c your onsite host worked for u, at least that was the impression i was given.  but u guys refused to take responsibility for helping  storage owner in his scam of ripping me off.  i just looked at the piece of paperwork he gave me.  it said nothing about receiving any money from me but the fact that it's a $150 a per month rental.  got duped big time.  perhaps next time u guys should make it loud and clear that YOUR onsite host really doesn't work for u and u got nothing to do with whatever your onsite host's actions or inactions. in addition, by reporting those two fraudsters, i have helped neighbor.com stop that onsite host's stealing customers from neighbor.com.  where is the gratitude in this?  the decent thing to do is to at least reimburse me for the funds i lost b/c of your help in facilitating their duping me by misrepresenting your onsite host as someone trustworthy working for neighbor.com.  btw, till this moment, i still don't even have any notification of a refund coming to me or a refund being issued notice. they took it out of my bank account and still no refund back in yet. UPDATE: finally got my refund from neighbor.com.  still yet to see my $140 from the storage owner.  do not expect the grateful neighbor.com site owner to help in this matter even though his/her employees have misrepresented THEIR onsite host to have caused me to trust the storage owner and then ended up giving him $140.  while there was never any contract signed, THEIR wonderful onsite host told me the cash was nonrefundable after i asked for my $140 being in the storage for less than 24 hours willfully.
